summary: This bill, the "Move the ICC Out of NYC Act of 2025," aims to prevent the International Criminal Court (ICC) from using United Nations facilities within the United States.  It cites the United Nations Headquarters Agreement and the US's non-ratification of the Rome Statute. The bill directs the US Ambassador to the UN to negotiate a supplemental agreement to prohibit the ICC's presence in UN facilities within the US. The bill is sponsored by Mr. Lee and was introduced in the Senate on March 4, 2025.
